title: Miroslav Beránek
text:
Miroslav Beránek (born 24 April 1957) is a <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="coach%20%28sports%29">coach</a> who was most recently the manager of the <a href="SK%20Slavia%20Prague">Slavia Prague</a>. As a player, he played over 100 matches as a <a href="defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> for Slavia Prague in the 1980s.
Coaching career.
Beránek took charge of Slavia Prague in the 1994–95 season. After managing <a href="Chmel%20Bl%C5%A1any">Chmel Blšany</a> in the Czech First League, he returned for a second spell at Slavia, where he won the <a href="2001%E2%80%9302%20Czech%20Cup">2001–02 Czech Cup</a>.
As coach of the <a href="Czech%20Republic%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Czech Republic U21 team</a>, he won the <a href="2002%20UEFA%20European%20Under-21%20Football%20Championship">2002 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship</a>. He has also coached several Czech clubs and worked abroad in <a href="Hungary">Hungary</a>, the <a href="United%20Arab%20Emirates">United Arab Emirates</a> and <a href="Kazakhstan">Kazakhstan</a>.
Beránek returned to manage Slavia in 2014 following 11 years away from the club.
